components.name: Button
components.description: Universal action control supporting clicks/press, navigation, loading/disabled states, icons, toggles, menus, and analytics hooks.

children.description: Button label/content. Required unless iconOnly=true and ariaLabel provided.

startIcon.description: Leading icon (LTR) / trailing in RTL if autoFlip=true.

endIcon.description: Trailing icon (LTR) / leading in RTL if autoFlip=true.

badge.description: Optional badge/chip counter attached to button.

loader.description: Loader shown in loading state; defaults to Spinner atom.

as.description: Render as native <button>, <a>, or framework router link component.

type.description: HTML button type (web only; ignored for links).

href.description: When as='a' or as='routerLink', destination URL/path.

rel.description: Link rel attribute. If target='_blank', enforce 'noopener noreferrer'.

density.description: Padding density; useful for ERP tables/toolbars.

iconOnly.description: Button contains only an icon; requires ariaLabel.

pressed.description: Toggle state; use aria-pressed when true/false and role is button.

expanded.description: Menu button expanded state; use aria-expanded.

ariaLabel.description: Accessible label. Required when iconOnly=true or children is not plain text.

ariaControls.description: ID of controlled element for menu/dialog.

hotkey.description: Keyboard shortcut hint, e.g. 'Ctrl+K'. Desktop/web optional.

requirements: Use <button> for actions; use <a> only for navigation.
If iconOnly=true then ariaLabel must be non-empty.
If pressed is used, set aria-pressed=true/false.
If expanded is used, set aria-expanded and aria-controls.
Ensure focus-visible ring is present and meets contrast guidelines.
Touch target minimum 44px on mobile (or equivalent dp).

web: Escape should close menus if button controls a menu (handled by parent)
desktop: Support hotkey hint; actual hotkey binding usually in app layer

contrast.default: Aim for WCAG AA contrast for text/icons vs background.

linkSafety: If target=_blank, force rel to include 'noopener noreferrer'.
Optionally validate href against allowlist in enterprise deployments.

components.name: IconButton
components.description: Icon-only button for toolbars and compact actions. Requires ariaLabel.

children.description: Button label/content. Required unless iconOnly=true and ariaLabel provided.

startIcon.description: Leading icon (LTR) / trailing in RTL if autoFlip=true.

endIcon.description: Trailing icon (LTR) / leading in RTL if autoFlip=true.

badge.description: Optional badge/chip counter attached to button.

loader.description: Loader shown in loading state; defaults to Spinner atom.

as.description: Render as native <button>, <a>, or framework router link component.

type.description: HTML button type (web only; ignored for links).

href.description: When as='a' or as='routerLink', destination URL/path.

rel.description: Link rel attribute. If target='_blank', enforce 'noopener noreferrer'.

density.description: Padding density; useful for ERP tables/toolbars.

iconOnly.description: IconButton is icon-only by default; ariaLabel required.

pressed.description: Toggle state; use aria-pressed when true/false and role is button.

expanded.description: Menu button expanded state; use aria-expanded.

ariaLabel.description: Required. Accessible label for icon-only buttons.

ariaControls.description: ID of controlled element for menu/dialog.

hotkey.description: Keyboard shortcut hint, e.g. 'Ctrl+K'. Desktop/web optional.

badgeCount.description: Optional badge count rendered near icon.

requirements: Use <button> for actions; use <a> only for navigation.
If iconOnly=true then ariaLabel must be non-empty.
If pressed is used, set aria-pressed=true/false.
If expanded is used, set aria-expanded and aria-controls.
Ensure focus-visible ring is present and meets contrast guidelines.
Touch target minimum 44px on mobile (or equivalent dp).

web: Escape should close menus if button controls a menu (handled by parent)
desktop: Support hotkey hint; actual hotkey binding usually in app layer

contrast.default: Aim for WCAG AA contrast for text/icons vs background.

linkSafety: If target=_blank, force rel to include 'noopener noreferrer'.
Optionally validate href against allowlist in enterprise deployments.
